comment_53:
I think this is about someone who sees these people or a person who need help "weak hands are calling". 

"Can't keep refusing rights, so he'll lend the cash" - He feels he has to help them, because they are human beings and he feels they have the right as any other human being does to not have to live maybe without food, water, shelter.  Things like that.  And so, he lends them the money to get on their feet.

"But the sin is on the hands of you," - He is now partially responsible for whatever this person or people do with the money he lent.  Do they use it to feed a substance abuse habit? This is what I think "sin" refers to.

"So to care or plead silence," - Do you continue to care and "help" someone who just keeps feeding their habit or do you "plead silence," meaning you do nothing?

"It won't change an empty stare," - To me this indicates the money won't help get the person or people on track with their life/lives because they only use the money to feed their habit.  Possibly "an empty stare" means someone who isn't in their right mind, they aren't completely there.  Maybe because they are taking drugs?

"These images hauntingly looks like hell," -  The man is obviously disturbed by what he is seeing.  People or a person addicted to drugs can really let themselves go when all they are concerned with is getting the next high or what not.  That's no life for them, and this person realizes that and is haunted by it.

The person is stuck between the decision to help or not.  If he helps, he knows the people or person will just give in to their habit.  If he doesn't, he continues to be haunted by these images.  So, he is very panicky over this and often thinks about it.  

I also think this could be attributed to a larger scale interpretation.  For instance, could the main person represent the government?  Just a thought, but this could go into controversial conversations, so I'll leave it at that.  But, what a great song!
